confession.seduction_context: Had been very angry with her son Jacquot, who had returned from Allemaigne, then refused to guard animals, so that she beat him. Usual seduction scene; gave her purse, offering her a bigger one which he showed her.

witnesses.name: Magdelaine femme Colas Cointzelin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: guarded animals with daughter of accused

testimony.quarrel_subject: Animals had strayed and been fined by Colas de Bonipaire; accused said witness should have prevented this as the eldest
testimony.threat_quote: que mal santé luy puisse venir

witnesses.name: Demenge Colas Jacquemin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: servant in house where accused lived

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: fell and dislocated shoulder as he left village

witnesses.name: Thoussainct Grand Didier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: had quarrel with husband over tithes

testimony.threat_quote: que tous ceulx qui se prendroient a luy n'en gaigneroient rien

harms_alleged.target: horse broke its leg and died
series of other animals over 2 years; unable to keep any calves successfully

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: began on day of quarrel over tithes

testimony.quarrel_subject: quarrel with her husband in tavern
meadow they rented jointly; they had cut hay first and taken more than their share

testimony.threat_quote: tu as dit des parolles a ma femme, mais il y viendra ung jour que je te morderay

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: some time later, trouble with one hand spread to other

testimony.quarrel_subject: children went to take apples from his tree which had fallen on neighbouring field owned by husband of accused

testimony.threat_quote: que mal proffict en puisse il faire et qu'ainsy en adviendroit il

testimony.quarrel_subject: wife had found one of her sons stealing turnips in their garden; later quarrelled about them talking of this at Laveline
testimony.threat_quote: mais qu'ilz en auroient leur raison

testimony.quarrel_subject: asked him to help fetch stones for new house, but he excused himself

harms_alleged.target: 4 fine cows and a bull, followed by some young calves

testimony.quarrel_subject: accused wanted to separate husbands who got together to drink

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 5 or 6 weeks later, afflicted by 'une maladie froide' through whole body

testimony.quarrel_subject: straying animals - returned straying animals immediately, but when one of hers strayed they insisted on payment

harms_alleged.target: fine young cow which was in calf

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same year after testifying against her at Wisembach

witnesses.name: Jennon femme Claude Jean Petit Colin

testimony.quarrel_subject: owed husband money and could not pay immediately
testimony.threat_quote: qu'elle eut le diable au ventre

testimony.quarrel_subject: husband quarrelled with husband of accused
testimony.threat_quote: Tais toy, tais toy, tu te menne bien mal tu ne seras pas sept ans la dedans

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: became ill 11 weeks after quarrel with Jean Casman, died in a week

testimony.quarrel_subject: first husband Demenge Aubert reluctant to help enclose field but finally agreed

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after eating tripes at her house, developed illness, died in Easter Week

timeline.subject: Françatte femme Jean Camont
timeline.details: End of April 1598; informations preparatoires begun

timeline.subject: Françatte femme Jean Camont
timeline.details: First interrogation of accused; denied all charges

timeline.subject: Françatte femme Jean Camont
timeline.details: Change de Nancy asks that she be confronted with witnesses; denied all charges, made general remarks that they were liars

timeline.subject: Françatte femme Jean Camont
timeline.details: Racked severely, but would confess nothing. Later same day or subsequently tortured again, racked 'fort estroictement', finally confessed

timeline.subject: Françatte femme Jean Camont
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approved execution, subject to reiteration without torture. Noted reiteration of torture was 'directement contre le droict et la pratique'

timeline.subject: Françatte femme Jean Camont
timeline.details: Retracted confession, said only confessed because of torture, but was content for them to put her to death. Then agreed confessions had been true when told Persin must have visited her

timeline.subject: Françatte femme Jean Camont
timeline.details: Seems to have discharged those she had accused

torture.restrictions: Change de Nancy noted that reiteration of torture was 'directement contre le droict et la pratique'

notable_quotes.speaker: Françatte femme Jean Camont
notable_quotes.french: que les faulx tesmoings ne la scauroient faire meschante, que tant plus il en y a, tant pis, qu'il vauldroit bien mieux qu'ilz fussent tous bruslez

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Aubert
notable_quotes.french: qu'il s'estoit bien deffendu d'aller ché ladite Françatte detenue que toutteffois s'estoit il encor mal deffendu, et que la dedans il avoit prins le morceau de la mort
notable_quotes.context: Said before dying that he had taken 'the morsel of death' at accused's house

material_culture.context: Accused drew knife to strike witness during quarrel
Devil gave her purse at seduction, offering bigger one
Used to harm animals and people; also yellow powder to heal
Obtained from accused's children to heal bewitched pigs
Used by devin to show effigy of accused
Given to Demenge Aubert containing piece that caused illness
Daniel Cointzelin bought knife at forge, said 'ha le mal cousteau' during illness
Given by healer to boil in new earthenware pot to make witch appear
New pot used for counter-magic ritual
Shared wine in glass with Demenge Jean Gerardin, put powder in it
Paid rent of chicken to be let off regular attendance at sabbat
Servant stole her oats at mill

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial, where accused lived
Where accused first lived when came to area 20+ years ago, many witnesses from here
Village that would not receive accused because she was rumoured to be witch
Where husband made threat in public before church
Where servant was sent to consult a woman (healer)
Where doctor set dislocated shoulder; where pigs were sold; where woman practiced healing
Where Jean Colin went to consult woman 'qui se mesloit de deviner'
Home of several witnesses
Home of witness Margueritte
Home of witness Claudette femme Gerard Ancel
Birthplace of accused
Where accused and family visited relative before catching plague
Where accused worked for lieutenant keeping animals for 5 years
Where accused started her service
Where accused ended service; where brother testified against accused and died
Where 2 of accused's children were; where son Jacquot returned from
Where accused talked about stolen turnips incident
Where Demenge Jean Gerardin was living 15 years earlier
Where Demenge Jean Gerardin visited medecin
Home of Dedielle femme Michiel Claudel, named accomplice
Where accused joined another woman after servant left village
Where husband made public threat
Where large company was present during quarrel with husband; widow of Jacquat Rolbel was hostess
Where servant stole accused's oats
Husband's workplace; where Demenge Jean Gerardin drank with miners
Rented jointly with Jean Colin, dispute over hay
Accused's garden where pigs were found; witness's garden where son was found stealing turnips

economic_hardship_indicators: Accused and husband had no property when came to area 20+ years ago
Not enough money for food due to husband's drinking
Multiple witnesses report massive animal losses (economic devastation)

prior_legal_disputes.description: Lawsuit over tithes with Thoussainct Grand Didier
Andreu Gerardin said husband 'habitoit et couchoit une sorciere' - husband obtained informal reparation before 'gens de bien'

legal_context.redress_outcome: Husband obtained informal reparation for defamation

change_de_nancy.modification_details: Approved execution subject to reiteration of confessions without any threat of torture. Added comment that reiteration of torture had been 'directement contre le droict et la pratique'

hearsay_chains.content: how he had been to devin after loss of a cow, and been shown an effigy he recognized as that of Françatte

emotional_state_notes: said false witnesses could not make her wicked
content for them to put her to death after retracting confession

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: made numerous general remarks that they were liars, bore false witness, were children of witches

third_parties.context: Blacksmith, made threats on behalf of accused

third_parties.context: Returned from Allemaigne, refused to guard animals, beaten by mother; this triggered her seduction according to confession

third_parties.context: Hostess at Layegoutte, mistress who sent servant to consult healer

third_parties.context: Friend who consulted doctor on behalf of Demenge Jean Gerardin, now dead

third_parties.context: Said illness taken by eating salad and drinking from glass given by woman

third_parties.context: Healer who said he would cure Demenge Jean Gerardin and make witch's face black

third_parties.name: Aulbert
third_parties.context: Accompanied Jean Camont when he made threat to Jacquot Rolbel

third_parties.name: Jean Demenge du Faing
third_parties.context: Accompanied Jean Camont when he made threat to Jacquot Rolbel

third_parties.name: woman at Ste Marie who practiced healing

third_parties.name: Jean Casman
third_parties.context: Quarrelled with Daniel Cointzelin shortly before marriage

third_parties.name: beggar-woman
third_parties.context: Asked for bread when accused was kneading dough; accused confessed to killing her

third_parties.name: cat
third_parties.context: Accused's own cat, killed when she tried out powder

economic_context.details: Accused and husband had no property when they arrived 20+ years ago. Lawsuit over tithes. Debt mentioned with Jennon femme Claude Jean Petit Colin (owed 4 or 5 gros). Dispute over meadow rented jointly with Jean Colin. Multiple witnesses report devastating animal losses (horses worth over 1000 francs, cows worth 30 écus). Accused's father was beggar/tailor. Economic hardship in household due to husband's drinking.

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with extensive witness testimony (20 witnesses), detailed confession under torture, retraction and renewal of confession, and execution. Trial notable for: 1) Change de Nancy's criticism of reiteration of torture as 'directement contre le droict et la pratique', 2) Extensive use of cunning folk/healers by witnesses for counter-magic, 3) Pattern of quarrel-threat-harm across nearly all testimonies, 4) Accused's defiant defense strategy, 5) Economic devastation reported by witnesses (animal losses worth over 1000 francs), 6) Complex confession narrative with healing as well as harming.
